bug.short_desc: Stack overflow in SafeChunkyInputStream on startup

long_desc.thetext:
3.2 Release
I've encountered a fatal error on startup shortly after selecting a workspace. From the log the error was on a call to org.eclipse.core.internal.compatability.PluginActivator while loading the bundle org.eclipse.core.resources. The root cause seems to be org.eclipse.core.internal.localstore.SafeChunkyInputStream.find() line 98. This line appears to be self-recursive. There are hundreds of identical consecutive lines in the log citing this line, and the exception that of a StackOverflow.
The following log entries are (perhaps unsurprisingly) NoClassDefinitionFound org/eclipse/core/resources/IContainer and then several jars not being resolved.
The problem seems to be caused whilst reading a file in .metadata/.plugins/org.eclipse.core.resources/.safetable, possibly org.eclipse.core.resources, since deleting this directory allows Eclipse to load normally again (though no projects are shown and so open editors are just placeholders). The problem does not rectify itself.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 98080 ***

Thanks for spotting this as a duplicate. Unfortunately I no longer have the details of this bug above what I initially posted, and haven't since encountered it, however I reported this bug against Eclipse 3.2 and the bug it has been marked as a duplicate of had a target milestone of 3.2M3, i.e. the version I reported against should have included the fix, so I'm not convinced that it's the same issue (though it is definitely very similar).
Ok, feel free to reopen with more details if you can reproduce in 3.3 or newer.

bug.short_desc: Permission-denied errors are not handled properly

long_desc.thetext:
On an ssh command shell, create a directory without permissions: mkdir notpermitted touch notpermitted/test.txt chmod 0 notpermitted
* After pressing refresh, try to expand the "notpermitted" node --> no error message is shown. --> Would expect an error "permission denied".
* Select any file, choose copy. Select the "notpermitted" dir, choose paste. --> An exception is printed to stderr --> Would expect an error dialog to pop up
In the second case, the problem most probably is, that there is no Shell to show the error dialog in.
Does the ssh service throw SystemMessageExceptions for these cases?
Yes it does, I saw them in the debugger - but they are caught away in upper levels (FileServiceSubSystem).
For my I'm not able to do a paste on the notpermitted dir - the right-click action is not available because of the missing permissions.

Right, thanks to latest ssh fixes the "writable" attribute is now checked and if the directory is not writable the action is not allowed.
But the problem still occurs if the directory is not readable, or not executable:
mkdir notReadable touch notReadable/test.txt chmod ugo-r notReadable mkdir notExecutable touch notExecutable/test.txt chmod ugo-x notExecutable
Problem is the same as reported originally - trying to open the directory, or to paste a file into it, silently fails. An error message would be expected.

I can't paste on the non-readable directory either. I do see the problem with the directory that has the missing executable permission. The problem there is that we don't query the executable permission bit.

IHostFile currently doesnt have a isExecutable() method. IRemoteFile does have "isExecutable()" and "isLink()" and AbstractRemoteFile determines their setting by looking at the classification ("exectuable" or "symbolic link").
It might be a good idea to add isExecutable() to IHostFile. But I'm not sure if it actually needs to be in the API -- one could argue that if a directory is not executable, it is not readable from the API point of view so the service should set canRead() false. What do you think about this suggestion?
My other point is, that even if the service sets all permission bits correctly, the FileServiceSubsystem should still report an error if it happens, because there are situations in which correctly reported permission bits are not sufficient: * If the directory state is not up-to-date (It was writable when last refreshed, but somebody set it read-only later or even deleted it) * If access control lists (acl's) are in place, the service cannot query permissions properly and access errors can happen at any time * Even with standard UNIX it can happen that the owner of a file or directory is somebody else and we cannot determine group membership correctly

Acutally, for not-executable directories, java.io.File sets canWrite() false: note that java.io.File also doesnt have isExecutable() and isLink() methods.
ls -l drw-rw-r-- test
test isDirectory(): true test canRead(): true test canWrite(): false

If a non-executable dir gets indicated by canWrite() == false then I'd expect this to work. What I'm seeing with RSE is that non-executable dirs still don't show up as readonly, whereas non-writeable dirs do.

I have made the not executable -> not writable directory change for ssh.
But I still claim that FileServiceSubsystem should take action in case of Exceptions and not silently ignore them. My arguing is in comment#6: - not-up-to-date issues - Access Control Lists (acls) - Not identifyable user ids / group memberships

Are you suggesting that we throw these exceptions (or some general exception) in the case where we did actually attempt a write but it failed? Or are you saying we should do additional queries to determine with 100% certainty whether the subsequent write will work?

I think the "perfect" sort of feedback for trying to open (expand) a folder when the Service returns a SystemMessageException would be to use a little "error" decorator on the folder and have in IRemoteFile something like boolean isError() SystemMessageException getError() that allows to show the error message in the Properties of the folder.
This would be less disruptive than an error message, but would still show the user what happened -- I believe this would be the "Eclipse Style" of hanlding this.
As long as we do not have such decorators, I think I'd like to see an error dialog just like a failing download: When I do "chmod a-r file.txt" and then dbl click on file.txt, I get a dialog saying "Operation failed. Security violation". Similarly,
- When I try to open (expand) a folder and the Service throws a SystemMessageException because permission is denied, an error dialog should be shown.
Otherwise, the user might think that this is just an empty directory. He wouldn't notice that it is shown empty because of a permission denied error.
This problem can be reproduced as in comment 0. The other problem (paste into notpermitted directory) I cannot reproduce any more.
Reducing to P4 since the copy&paste issue is not reproducable any more.

I've added the ability to throw SystemMessageExceptions back on fetch operations for the file system. Also a canRead() call is made before any fetch, and if that returns false, we throw the exception. An system message error object shows up under the expanded folder. This is how RSE has addressed these kinds of situations in the past - not sure whether you like this or not.

Great fix. I really like the "Error" style subnodes, because they convey more information than just the decorator.
Two more comments: 1.) For the "Error" node, the secondLevelMessage of the SystemMessageException should be visible in the Properties, when you select the node. This may help diagnosing problems. Can be tested on ssh, when you do "chmod 0 notpermitted" on a directory and then try to expand it.
2.) Your fix currently doesnt work when I just strip the "executable" bit from the directory: mkdir notpermitted mkdir notpermitted/subdir chmod a-x notpermitted Refresh, then try to expand notpermitted --> I'd expect to see the error node, but I just see the empty folder.
Thanks!
For a non-executable directory - should that be treated as unreadable?
In the case of a non-readable directory, we currently don't have a second level message. I'm not sure what we could say in addition to what we do currently.

bug.short_desc: [shells] Shell commands like mkdir, touch should force directory refresh

long_desc.thetext: Shell commands like mkdir, touch should force directory refresh in the file system, in order to allow proper content assist on the new resource.
Nice idea but not for 1.0
Need to investigate - Implementation not planned yet.
Not for 2.0

bug.short_desc: Script generated in SVG chart when scripting disabled

long_desc.thetext: If I use the Birt Chart API to render a chart to an SVG document and I call RunTimeContext.setScriptingEnabled(false) to disable scripting, the resulting document still contains scripts.
Talked with the reporter and it was okay to retarget this bug to 2.2.0

bug.short_desc: Support Keyboard Shortcuts for browsing

long_desc.thetext:
Should support the following shortcuts
ALT+D Set keyboard focus to the Address Bar F5 or CTRL+R Refresh CTRL+F5 Refresh Completely (this one is important) ESC Stop ALT+LeftArrow Back ALT+RightArrow Forward
Moving this enhancement request to SWT, since ATF now uses SWT Browser.

SWT just wraps native controls, it never adds helpers like this.
Clients are free to add these though, now that the Browser fires key events on all platforms. The only sugegsted command that would require JavaXPCOM is Refresh Completely.
Moving back to ATF since adding these may be desirable at that level.

bug.short_desc: MozillaBrowserEditor: LocationChange triggering problem when clicking anchors with JS code

long_desc.thetext:
The same problem as in Bug 148659. When clicking on an Anchor with a javascript URL, ONLY the LocationListener.changing() is triggered which unhooks the DOMEvent Listeners from the Document.
This stops all Hover Selection, Key Events, and Mutation Events.
Fixed by ignoring changing() when the location starts with "javascript:". This should probably be fixed at a lower level in the SWT component.

The patch fixes the Data Output Preferences persistence problem.

bug.short_desc: [Perspectives][ViewMgmt] Need smarter Min/Max view behaviour

long_desc.thetext:
The current min/max behaviour isn't very useful for typical usage. The problem is that most tasks require access to information in more than one view. Maximizing a given view or editor prevents access to the other necessary information.
For example, consider the simplest starting point of Navigator-Editor-Outline.
Task (A): First, you need to navigate to the item you care about. We'll call this task "Finding".
When browsing through the navigator, one needs the editor to see if the item you've selected is the one you're looking for, but you generally don't need the Outline. So you'd like more space for the Navigator, medium for the Editor, and little or none for the outline. One solution is to minimize the Outline.
Task (B): Now you want to modify the item you found (say, edit the Java class). We'll call this task "Authoring".
Once you are editing, you'll want more space for the Editor, and you no longer really need the navigator, but you do require the outline. One solution is to minimize the Navigator. But if you followed the steps above, you must now also restore the Outline. Note that maximizing the Editor won't give you what you want because you require the Outline (you may decide to live without outline because its easier than doing the require sequence of min/max).
A common sequence is one of Finding, Authoring, Finding, Authoring, ... Using current min/max support, the user must spend a considerable amount of time just manipulating the UI, which quickly becomes tedious.
Fast views are one solution but they have their own limitations. In our example, using the Navigator as a fast view causes it to cover the very Editor whose contents you must check to see if you've navigated to the right item. Because fast views obscure the workbench, they are generally only suited to highly modal finding where all the information required is contained in the Fast View itself.

Kevin, see defect 153957 for where I'm at with this (i.e. not finished for sure...;-). Perhaps we can extend the idea to allowing multiple 'arrangements' with some 'quick-switch' mechanism.
Another approach might be to extend the perspective customiation mechanism to allow for easy creation for Finding and Authoring versions...

(In reply to comment #1) > Could you please provide a thread dump? > Thanks. > Reopen when thread dump is available. >
Would you be able to provide some instructional informations on how to produce the thread dump that you need and for which process ?

To get a thread dump, start Eclipse with -consolelog. In the DOS console, you can hit Ctrl+Break to get a thread dump. Please provide seveal thread dumps, copy/paste them in a file and attach the file to this bug.

bug.short_desc: [validation] UIEarValidator fails when importing projects from an archive

long_desc.thetext:
I tried importing a set of three inter-related projects (ear, web, and utility) contained in a zip file using the Import -> Existing Projects into Workspace wizard and selecting an archive file instead of a directory. I got the following exception in the log:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Attempted to beginRule: L/TeamWeb/WebContent/META-INF/MANIFEST.MF, does not match outer scope rule: L/TeamEar/EarContent/META-INF/application.xml at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Assert.isLegal(Assert.java:62) at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.ThreadJob.illegalPush(ThreadJob.java:116) at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.ThreadJob.push(ThreadJob.java:225) at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.ImplicitJobs.begin(ImplicitJobs.java:80) at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.JobManager.beginRule(JobManager.java:219) at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.WorkManager.checkIn(WorkManager.java:96) at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.prepareOperation(Workspace.java:1684) at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.File.setContents(File.java:358) at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.File.setContents(File.java:462) at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.impl.URIConverterImpl$PlatformResourceOutputStream.flush(URIConverterImpl.java:142) at org.eclipse.jem.util.emf.workbench.WorkbenchByteArrayOutputStream.flush(WorkbenchByteArrayOutputStream.java:78) at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.impl.URIConverterImpl$PlatformResourceOutputStream.close(URIConverterImpl.java:102) at org.eclipse.jem.util.emf.workbench.WorkbenchByteArrayOutputStream.close(WorkbenchByteArrayOutputStream.java:67) at org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.internal.project.ManifestFileCreationAction.createManifestFile(ManifestFileCreationAction.java:35) at org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.internal.project.J2EEProjectUtilities.getManifestFile(J2EEProjectUtilities.java:258) at org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.internal.project.J2EEProjectUtilities.getManifestFile(J2EEProjectUtilities.java:237) at org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.internal.validation.UIEarValidator.getManifestFile(UIEarValidator.java:611) at org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.internal.validation.UIEarValidator.validateManifests(UIEarValidator.java:250) at org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.internal.validation.UIEarValidator.validateInJob(UIEarValidator.java:220) at org.eclipse.wst.validation.internal.operations.ValidatorJob.run(ValidatorJob.java:70) at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)
It looks like when the ear validator is invoked, the web app hasn't been loaded yet, so when the ear validator makes the getManifestFile call, that function attempts to create the manifest file and causes this failure.
Let me know if the stack trace is not enough and I can attach the zip file that can be used to repro this.
Please attach the zip file.
Created an attachment (id=48657) Repro App

Created an attachment (id=48708) Patch
While i can't reproduce this, i believe this patch should fix the problem. Please test it.

Yeah, the problem has an intermittent streak to it. Some days it reproduces fairly consistently. Some days I can't reproduce it at all.
I tried the patch and didn't see this problem in 10 tries. I also examined the code and agree that the patch should fix the problem.
approve
Approve.
approve
code in CVS.
Verified, closing.

bug.short_desc: [Intro] Welcome Root in small window doesn't show Scroll Bars - clips buttons

long_desc.thetext:
Welcome: The "Go to workbench" icon is cut off from full view in default window size
screen shot attached.
Icon "Go to Workbench" is mostly hidden when RMT is launched. Window size has to be adjusted to include all icons in full view. w/o scroll bars.
Created an attachment (id=48149) Screen Capture of problem
It was assumed that products that use the intro should have a certain minimum size. Would it be possible to increase the default size here? It seems smaller than the other products.

The 'Circles' theme does not work below a certain size. Scroll bars make it turn into cheeze due to browser/CSS limitations. As a result, we turned the scroll bars off and there is a screen size requirement. See what Eclipse SDK uses for the initial window size.
*** Bug 156463 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
I think that we need to solve this case. We should be able to get the scroll bars to show up only when the root page is forced into a screen smaller than the usable minumum size.

bug.short_desc: Bookmarks generation control for table groups is not friendly/undocumented.

long_desc.thetext:
1. Load the attached TOCTest.rptdesign 2. Render the report as PDF. See the attached result 3. Select the table and then navigate to "Groups" tab 4. double-click on the grouping entry -- you will see the dialog (see attached screenshots) 5. In the dialog try to remove the TOC Item expression value. Press Ok 6. Now, repeat steps 3 and 4. You'll see that the value is preserved.
The problem here is that -- it is impossible turn off generation of the bookmarks per group. Auto-generation of bookmarks per groups in tables is a nice feature in some cases but in others it is unwanted and prevents user from achieving his own custom bookmarks structure.
P.S. I just became aware of the workaround -- to set TOC Expression to 'null'. This workaround does work.
EXPECTATION: implement *user-friendly* UI control that allows to enable/disable TOC entries generation for table groups.
Was this fixed already?

Now group default does not auto generation bookmark, if user want to generation the bookmark, should set the toc expression.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 126308 ***

bug.short_desc: Please update AJDT dev with recent AspectJ dev build

long_desc.thetext: It looks like the ajde.jar being bundled with AJDT is from August 1st, predating a bug fix our project needs to compile properly. Is there a policy as to when the dev builds of AJDT get new dev builds of AspectJ?

Done - 1.4.1.200608210736 for Eclipse 3.2 contains AspectJ version 1.5.3.200608210847 (with a build for 3.3M1 to follow shortly)
The download page has also been improved to indicate exactly which AspectJ version is included in which dev build.
When the restructure underway in bug 113948 is complete, we plan to automate the process of integrating AspectJ into AJDT, which will result in a much faster turnaround of AspectJ fixes getting into AJDT.
Great thanks! It will indeed be good when the new bundle structuring of AspectJ builds makes it easier to update AspectJ inside AJDT.

bug.short_desc: [Workbench] Unified Open Type.. API/extension point

long_desc.thetext: When editing a C/C++ file (using CDT) in the Java perspective two Open Type.. action buttons are visible in the toolbars, one for Java and one for C/C++. Two identical buttons with the same tooltip but different functions is confusing (not that mixing languages isn't). It would make sense to combine them somehow and allow other plugins to contribute their own functionality.
Related to plan item from bug 154104.

We now have an abstract class for this so that the behaviour of all the different selection dialogs can be consistent for different kinds of items being selected: See FilteredItemsSelectionDialog and its subclasses.
Not sure if combining Java and C/C++ types in one dialog is the way to go.
Marking this one as worksforme. If we decide to combine Java types and C/C++ types in one search, that search engine should combine even more searchable objects (help, resources, maybe even the contents of the Quick Access dialog). We should have a bug open for this one but I couldn't find it.

Perhaps I filed a possible solution rather than the problem I was trying to address. I wasn't necessarily meaning mixing types in one dialogue - that could be confusing and would probably be better suited to "Open Resource" or a new "Open Element". I suppose I was thinking of making Open Type closer to a retargetable action so the types that are shown are dependent on the context in which it the dialogue is opened (selection, focused parts, perspective etc). The problem I was trying to address was having duplicate buttons with different actions.
Of course now Eclipse is becoming such a successful platform I suspect there are more things which could be abstracted out of existing plugins e.g. JDT's declaration view. Still, that's another bug, and your solution of a common selection dialogue class sounds even better than one specific to Open Type.
Thanks for looking into this.

Under the CVS control, when import modifies a file (say, a configuration xmi file) from readOnly to non-readOnly using workspace's "validateEdit" method, the eclipse CVS plugin makes a backup of the original file under local CVS/base directory.
This confuses the tool, becasue the "configurations" folder allows configuration xmi files to exist under sub-directories of "configurations".
Looks like it would be hard to resolve this issue from import implementation. We may have to handle it from persistency side.
Exclude team-private files under configurations from being loaded.

verified, closed.

bug.short_desc: WebDAV does not work on ports other than 80

long_desc.thetext:
WebDAV server is actually set up on a port other than 80. But there doesn't appear to be a way to configure WebDAV to use a specific port.
Entering a target site URL like: http://mydavsite.somedomain.com:8080/ results in an Eclipse error Error communicating with DAV server: 403 Forbidden
Setting up the WebDAV server to service port 80, and entering the same target site URL sans port designation: http://mydavsite.somedomain.com/ connects fine.
This component is no longer being actively developed. We encourage users to investigate the capabilities of the Eclipse Web Tools Project.

bug.short_desc: Provide means for users to safely clear non-essential plugin data

long_desc.thetext: The plugin work areas in workspace .metadata directories can quickly become large, and when there is a need to free up space it isn't clear what of this can be safely deleted. A clean-up API would help in such instances so that each plugin can clear up any non-essential files in its space, e.g. file histories, locally deployed server files etc. This could take the form of a simple button in the About dialog or a more wizard-like interface, such as the Java code cleanup wizard or the Windows disk cleanup wizard. It might also be a useful feature to schedule, e.g. clean up on close.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 153321 ***

bug.short_desc: consider adding deleted resources to active Change Set

long_desc.thetext: Currently the change set management ignores deleted resources, which is annoying because they have to be manually added to the Change Set or selected explicitly for the commit.

Created an attachment (id=54223) mylar/context/zip

Hi Mik, with Mylyn 2.0 I cannot get this to work: every time I locally delete a file, it is added to the "Unassigned" change set, instead of the currently active task change set... Could it be a regression?
Mauro.

Is the editor open for the file you are deleting? If so the editor will close, which will make the file less interesting. You could test by renaming a file, since this won't cause the editor to close.

Hi Mik, I did some tests. I created a new Local task called "Prova", activated it and modified some files: the changes went into "Prova" change set. Then: 1) I deleted a file that was neither modified nor opened: the corresponding change fell into the "Unassigned" change set 2) I deleted a file that was modified: the corresponding change correctly fell into "Prova" change set 3) I opened a file that was not modified and, with the editor open, I deleted it: the corresponding change fell into "Unassigned" change set (please note: when I say "not modified", I mean that the file is synchronized with the repository; when I say "modified", I mean that I had already made a change, so that the file was marked as locally modified)
When using the refactoring feature of JDT, I got ambiguous results: sometimes the two changes (the addition of the "new" class and the deletion of the "old" one) correctly fell into "Prova" change set, some other times the addition fell into "Prova" change set while the deletion into the "Unassigned" one. This seems not related to the fact that the refactored class is open in the editor or not, but it has to be synchronized with the repository before doing the refactoring. Maybe you should be able to reproduce in this way: - delete a not modified file - refactor another not modified class You'll see two changes in the "Unassigned" change set.
Please note I'm using CVS repository.
I hope to have been of help. Mauro.

Hi Mik, do you have any news about this bug? Shouldn't it be reopened? Or do you think I should better open a new one?
Thanks in advance, Mauro.
I'll reopen to investigate.

bug.short_desc: New feature for disabling smantic-check when open a report design/library

long_desc.thetext:
When open a library/report design, the semantic check always performs. It cost extra time. In some cases, this check is not necessary.
Need an option for disabling semantic-check when opens files.

Add some methods like open(String fileName, ModuleOption options) to disable the semantic checks. Call ModuleOption.setSemanticCheck(false) to close it, be default, Model will do all the semantic checks for an opened module.

bug.short_desc: Report doesn't include the library when drag an embedded image from lib explorer and drop onto layout editor

long_desc.thetext: Drap an embedded image form lib explorer and drop onto layout editor means: extends the embedded image into the target report firstly and then drag and drop it onto layout editor. So if the source library hasn't been included yet, the report should include the library in this operation.
Fixed. Added codes to include library in the drop handling.

bug.short_desc: [Viewers] Provide widget independent TableViewer implementation

long_desc.thetext: At the moment the concrete classes to provide a table or a tree require that the underlying Widget is an org.eclipse.widgets.Table and org.eclipse.widgets.Tree. It would make sense to extract all code parts who don't depend on the concrete-widget to an AbstractBaseClass between: - ColumnViewer > TableViewer => ColumnViewer > AbstractBaseTableViewer > TableViewer - AbstractTreeViewer > TreeViewer => AbstractTreeViewer > AbstractBaseTreeViewer > TreeViewer

Created an attachment (id=48162) First rough Version for TableViewer independency
This patch already incooperates the the base class for TableViewerImpl and to avoid breakage of TableTree and maybe the API-Contracts a class named AbstractTableViewerEditorImpl.
Maybe some words about what's done in this patch: - AbstractTableViewer widget independet BaseClass for viewers representing Tables all parts where the native control is used are marked as abstract and start with "native" maybe those could be moved to ColumnViewer because they are common to all Table/TreeViewers although this would be we need to update TableTreeViewer - AbstractViewerEditor all common things of TableEditorImpl/TreeEditorImpl - AbstractTableViewerEditorImpl common things for TableControls - TableViewer implements the abstract methods needed - TableViewerRow new method to clear item - TreeViewerRow new method to clear item - ViewerRow new abstract method to clear item (maybe this should be changed to provide a default implementation sub-classes can overwrite if they are not happy)
The process for TreeViewer would be similar.
Created an attachment (id=48271) Fix some small visibility bugs

Created an attachment (id=48273) Example how a Viewer for Nebula-Grid is programmed
Just as an example and how easy it would be to use other widgets ;-)

Created an attachment (id=48301) Fixed more Visibilities
Most important visiblity changes: - EditingSupport public class so external packages like nebula could subclass it - EditingSupport made protected so subclasses from other packages could overwrite - ViewerColumn#setEditingSupport now public - ViewerColumn: removed dead commentened code parts
I've now made some test with this code and couldn't find any problems maybe you Boris and Tod could look at it and tell me what you think about this some day this week on IRC.

I don't think Boris has looked yet but here are some comments
1) The basic refactoring looks to me to be moving all of TableViewer to abstract table viewer and then factoring out all of the code that references the table directly correct?
2) I am not sure I like having the table show up in two fields (one on each class) although I am not that upset about it.
3) The code moves away from the idea of accessing the widget directly by having the nativeGet* methods. Although this is different from our usual pattern I think it is neccessary here.
This is fair amount to absorb as a lot of it has no javadoc yet - we should talk over IRC this week.

(In reply to comment #6) > I don't think Boris has looked yet but here are some comments > > 1) The basic refactoring looks to me to be moving all of TableViewer to > abstract table viewer and then factoring out all of the code that references > the table directly correct?
Yes. That's the idea. So all is widget independent only Widget and Item are used for now and even Item wouldn't really be necessary but there are some methods in StructuredViewer who need Item although when looking internally they don't need it (I think it was associate/disassociate).
> > 2) I am not sure I like having the table show up in two fields (one on each > class) although I am not that upset about it. >
Maybe an abstract method like getControl() could help here. So the table is only stored in the concrete class which would make sense?
> 3) The code moves away from the idea of accessing the widget directly by having > the nativeGet* methods. Although this is different from our usual pattern I > think it is neccessary here.
Well I also thought about a delegate pattern so we won't bloat the interface with all those nativeGet* methods. So you would pass SWTTableDelegate, NebulaGridDelegate, ... to AbstractTableViewer
> > This is fair amount to absorb as a lot of it has no javadoc yet - we should > talk over IRC this week. >
Sorry for that. Yes I left out javadoc for now because first of all I wanted to here from you what you think before I put too much effort into something not acceptable because of my design.

Overall, I like it, but I am not sure how it affects > the performance of TableViewer. Also, before we commit to this as API, I would > like it to be validated by others, minimally Nebula. (Would this be useful for > anybody else other than Nebula?) >
Do you think that the function calls really matter? For large Tables where it might matter one uses SWT.VIRTUAL.
> Does Nebula support SWT.VIRTUAL at all? If not, does it still make sense to > have the VIRTUAL support in BaseTableViewer?
Well I think Chris mentionned somewhere that he'll work on it. But IMHO it doesn't harm us, does it? The only thing we wouldn't need then are the 3 API functions dealing with virtual.
> > I will attach a corresponding patch against Nebula with an updated GridViewer > and a snippet on bug 146945. >
Great work Boris.

Yes I do plan to implement SWT.VIRTUAL in the Grid. The Grid performs better than a normal Table (on Win anyway) but would still benefit from virtual support.
More follow up comments in bug 146945.

Ok. After we decided that we won't provide a widget independent version of TableViewer I took a look at TreeViewer and don't think that we need to take any action on the JFace-side.
We already have an widget independent implementation namely AbstractTreeViewer Nebula could provide it's own implementation on top of it. Most parts of TreeViewer only deal with the VIRTUAL-case which Grid doesn't support at the moment.

(In reply to comment #16) > Ok. After we decided that we won't provide a widget independent version of > TableViewer ...
Just for the record - we won't provide a widget independent table viewer base class unless there is a client for it who can validate our new API. Without a client, we won't produce additional API.
The "updated patch" (2006-10-11) can be applied against HEAD as of that date to see how the refactoring would have worked, should this become interesting again in the future.
Chris, have you tried subclassing AbstractTreeViewer?

I haven't personally, but another guy on my team Ross has. Apparently there are alot of package level methods/classes that are in the way. From Ross:
StructuredViewer.buildLabel() CustomHashTable TreeEditorImpl
These are preventing us from just subclassing AbstractTreeViewer.

(In reply to comment #18) > I haven't personally, but another guy on my team Ross has. Apparently there > are alot of package level methods/classes that are in the way. From Ross: > > StructuredViewer.buildLabel() > CustomHashTable > TreeEditorImpl > > These are preventing us from just subclassing AbstractTreeViewer. >
I'm currently working on a base implementation for TreeEditorImpl/TableEditorImpl it would have been part of Widget independency see bug #153993.
Nevertheless I until today I'm not convinced that nebface doesn't want to provide 2 viewers for its Grids (one Tablebased, one Treebased) because I think many people (e.g. /me) will use it as an replacement for Table because of many limitations found in the native tables.
It would be the same as if we would make TableViewer a subclass of AbstractTreeViewer.

Tom I'm all twisted up by your last comment. Not sure if you are advocating one viewer or two.?
My latest thinking was simply to provide both viewers to keep in step with JFace.

(In reply to comment #20) > Tom I'm all twisted up by your last comment. Not sure if you are advocating > one viewer or two.? > > My latest thinking was simply to provide both viewers to keep in step with > JFace. >
If you read Boris comment carefully ;-)
(In reply to comment #17) > (In reply to comment #16) > > Ok. After we decided that we won't provide a widget independent version of > > TableViewer ... > > Just for the record - we won't provide a widget independent table viewer base > class unless there is a client for it who can validate our new API. Without a > client, we won't produce additional API. >
I'm adocating 2 Viewers:
- nebface.TableViewer based upon BaseTableViewer - nebface.TreeViewer based upon AbstractTreeViewer (or if needed BaseTreeViewer)
Maybe time for another chat session?

(In reply to comment #18) > I haven't personally, but another guy on my team Ross has. Apparently there > are alot of package level methods/classes that are in the way. From Ross: > > StructuredViewer.buildLabel() > CustomHashTable > TreeEditorImpl
Chris regarding TreeEditorImpl could you take a look at AbstractViewerEditor from bug #153993
> > These are preventing us from just subclassing AbstractTreeViewer. >
if this suites your needs and Boris and Tod agree with my proposal there are only 2 items left ;-) Although I'm uncertain we should provide access to StructuredViewer.buildLabel()

Looks like the AbstractViewerEditor would work for nebula.
My initial comments I gave chris was using the 3.2 release. I went back and pulled the latest version from cvs. Using the TreeViewer as a template I tried to create a quick and dirty NTreeViewer but ran into the following visibility problems when simply extending from AbstractTreeViewer.
AbstractTreeViewer.internalFindItems(Object parentElementOrTreePath) AbstractTreeViewer.internalRefreshStruct(Widget widget, Object element, boolean updateLabels) ColumnViewer.updateCell(ViewerRow rowItem, int column) CustomHashTable StructuredViewer.newHashtable(int capacity) StructuredViewer.buildLabel ViewerColumn.COLUMN_VIEWER_KEY
I didn't have a chance to actually see if these methods really needed to have their visibility modified. However if TreeViewer needed to make use of them then it stands to reason the nebula tree viewer will need them also. Alternatively if we introduced AbstractBaseTreeViewer then i don't think the majority if not all of the methods would need to have their visibility changed.
Again I did this somewhat quickly and didn't have a chance to do a full investigation into just extending AbstractTreeViewer.

Thanks Ross for you info. I'm getting that my first feeling on BaseTreeViewer was not appropriate and that we should provide real widget independency.
In my view AbstractTreeViewer is not really sufficient and is to some extend designed badly (e.g. overwriting getCellModifier(),...), internal methods (newItem, ...) to declared as such, ... .
In an ideal world my JFace-Viewer-Structure would look like this:
+ ColumnViewer (provide all common to column based viewers) + BaseTableViewer (widget independent implementation for Table like Widgets) + VirtualTableViewer (virtual support for table based widgets) + [SWT]TableViewer (Real implementation for org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Table) + GridTableViewer (Real implementation for org.eclipse.nebula.wigets.Grid) + AbstractTreeViewer (needed for backwards compatility) + BaseTreeViewer (provide support for Tree based widgets) + VirtualTreeViewer (virtual support for tree based widgets) + [SWT]TreeViewer(Real implementation for org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Tree) + GridTreeViewer (Real implementation for org.eclipse.nebula.wigets.Grid)
That would be an ideal world which we maybe cannot provide without breaking backwards compatility but in this world ever class would be responsible for what it is designed. Table/TreeViewer code would be so much easier to read if virtual /non virtual would be dealt with in one viewer.
But I go along with Boris that if Nebula won't provide a GridTableViewer it wouldn't make sense to JFace to provide such a "dangerous" refactoring and blowing up of API if there's no customer.
For TreeViewer aka BaseTreeViewer I'll try to come up with something in the next few days/weeks eventually after M3 is out.

Nebula will definitely include the viewers and I expect that my team will become consumers of these new viewers. So we should be able to put the code and API through its paces before 3.3 gets released. I just need to get mgmt buy in.

Created an attachment (id=52278) Just for reference
Ross just for reference how a BaseTreeViewer with AbstractViewerEditor would look like. BaseTreeViewer as outlined in my above comment doesn't support VIRTUAL Trees but that doesn't hurt Grid, its just for refernce, I haven't tested nor validated it against any thing.

(In reply to comment #25) > Nebula will definitely include the viewers and I expect that my team will > become consumers of these new viewers. So we should be able to put the code > and API through its paces before 3.3 gets released. I just need to get mgmt > buy in. >
Great news Chris. This means BaseTableViewer has a customer if I get you right ;-) I think bug #153993 with this one will provide the flexibility we are all after see me implementation of BaseTreeViewer (although created just within 1h6mins) is a good starting point.

Some issues here
should BaseTableViewer be called AbstractTableViewer in order to be consistent with AbstractTreeViewer?
the ViewerRow#clear() method is not well documented. I know what it is doing because I know the code base well but it would never be clear to anyone else maintaining this.

(In reply to comment #28) > Some issues here > > should BaseTableViewer be called AbstractTableViewer in order to be consistent > with AbstractTreeViewer? >
Well and how do we then name the widget independent TreeViewer AbstractTreeViewer is not possible? I think if we provide 2 widget-independent viewers their naming should be consitent, so we need to find a name for Tree and Table.
FWIW Grid will support virtual soon. Please don't design the classes assuming Grid won't have virtual support.

> Just for the record - we won't provide a widget independent table viewer base > class unless there is a client for it who can validate our new API. Without a > client, we won't produce additional API.
We've gotten the go ahead and my team will upgrade to the latest 3.3 milestone in the next week or so. We will adopt the milestones as we progress. So we can be a heavy consumer of the new API. We're looking forward to it as it will really save us alot of code.
Created an attachment (id=54624) Patch to make TableViewer widget independent

Created an attachment (id=54727) Patch after discussing with Boris
- class renamed BaseTableViewer to AbstractTableViewer - internal* changed to do* to stay consitent with other Viewers - removed clearing of items in internalRefreshAll hence no ViewerRow#clear() needed

This bug is getting longer and longer should we recreate a new one for TreeViewer widget independency, rename this one so we could mark the TableViewer fixed and check that easily in the next M-Build?

Some of the methods were still called internal..., so I renamed them to do...
Also, I cleaned up the Javadoc a bit and added @since 3.3 tags.
Changed patch released >20061208.
Thank you Boris. I only renamed the methods I add to do*. All of you who are interested about widget independent support for Tree-style widgets. Should subscribe to bug #167323.
Verified in I20061212-0010 by inspecting code

bug.short_desc: [Workbench] [RCP] ability to customize multi-save dialog

long_desc.thetext: hi, i'm not only want to customize the single save dialog (ISaveablePart2) i also want to show a multi-save dialog when programm exits like we have it when we don't implement ISaveablePart2. if we implement ISaveablePart2, on programm close for every dirty editor ISaveablePart2.promptToSaveOnClose() is called.
Did you have a look at Saveable and ISaveablesSource (new in 3.2)? Is this what you are looking for?

no! i want to control and create the multi-save dialog shown on close if more than 1 editors are dirty on my own. the problem is that i can't use the standard multi-save dialog cause my dirty editors cannot saved all because some of them are invalid althought they are dirty. you know what i mean with multi-save dialog?

(In reply to comment #2) > i want to control and create the multi-save dialog shown on close if more than > 1 editors are dirty on my own.
This does not feel right to me. Can you describe your use case? Perhaps there is another way that does not involve custom dialogs.

Created an attachment (id=48442) multi-save-dialog
i want to create my own multi-save-dialog like the one i attached
and this is not possible cause for every editor a method is fired and not a method for all dirty editors...

(In reply to comment #4) > i want to create my own multi-save-dialog like the one i attached
We open a dialog like this already. Again, what is your use case for a separate custom dialog for your editors? You mentioned that your editors might be in an invalid state where they cannot be saved. Would it help to add another constant ("SKIP") to ISaveablePart2?

My use case: i work on an application where the user can enter data that is checked against a set of business rules. if the user has enetered invalid data and then want's to close the application, the multi-save dialog should reflect the invalid state of the editor(s) (the invalid editors should be marked with an x and should not be checkable).
i can imagine that we will need further enhancements for this dialog in the future which is why i would like to be able to create my own version of this dialog.

bug.short_desc: Cannot install SoapUI via update manager

long_desc.thetext: While trying to install soapUI from http://www.soapui.org/eclipse/update/site.xml via update manager I'm experiencing the following issue. After finding the SOAPUI package > Next, Accepting the LGPL > Next, the final installation dialog appears, displaying SOAPUI Feature 0.3.2 to be installed. Only the Finish button is disabled! Installing other features (e.g. lint4j) works fine. Workspace logfile is empty, no error or warning displayed.
Do you have anything in your log? What OS are you running (it says XP), and if it is XP which version is it? 64 bit? Did you have enough disk space? It shows at the bottom of that page.
XP32 SP2, no disc space issue. Did another install after experiencing this problem, problem still there.

Andrea, I looked at the update site and they list one of their plug-ins to be 12GB which is a lot and it looks like they made an error. In case it is not a mistake I guess you will have to get bigger HDD ;).

Updated the SoapUI bug with your information at
http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=1546473&group_id=136013&atid=737763
Branko, how could I verify this- it's not part of the site.xml, is it?

Received confirmation from SoapUI team:
Thanks btripkov! The download-size was listed in bytes instead of KBytes. I have fixed this now, so hopefully it should work fine now. /Lars

I can now confirm that fixing the feature file size on the SoapUI site fixed the problem.
I'm still wondering if this is at least worth an Eclipse platform enhancement request- even if disc space is exceeded (for whatever reason) at least an indication in the installation UI would be helpful.
Should I open new bug or could smdb. update the status of this?
Thanks, Andi
Moved to bug 159712

bug.short_desc: Refresh of a Treeviewer due to a filter change causes a JVM crash when SWT is trying to delete old items of the tree

long_desc.thetext:
We make use of a Treeviewer, which we apply different filters to, to change the items of the tree that are shown. The problem arises when we change the filters and thus cause the SWT framework to dispose any not longer needed items of the tree through some native Windows method. In that communication sometimes a JVM crash occurs (see report below). However, we were not able to reproduce the problem reliably - it seems to happen frequently infrequent...
I hope the report below gives you an idea of what's going on. If you need more information, please let us know.
Thanks!
Stefan

bug.short_desc: the mix-up of MI commands while debugging of multi-threaded programs

long_desc.thetext:
I saw the mix-up of MI commands while debugging of multi-threaded programs.
When did "continue" with the stack frames tree of threads in the Debug view stayed expanded, Eclipse trys to refresh all these threads when the target got stopped next time. It causes the simultaneous accesses to different threads on the target, and sometimes got errors by the mischoice of the thread.
I got the tracing log of one of these cases, in where getting local variables information by the Variables view failed in collision with the refreshing of the Debug view.

Created an attachment (id=48159) the tracing log of org.eclipse.cdt.debug.mi.core
In the log, Debug view retrieves the number of stack frames of thread 1, 2 and 6, while Variables view creating variable objects for the local variables declared on thread 6.

Created an attachment (id=48160) test source code
I have done the test on Cygwin, but the issue should be occured on any platform.

Created an attachment (id=48161) the screen shot
You can see variables "n" and "i" on the Variables view got errors.
bug# 151253 sounds very similiar to this, could you try the HEAD of 3.1 branch code and see if your problem goes away.

(In reply to comment #4) > bug# 151253 sounds very similiar to this, could you try the HEAD of 3.1 branch > code and see if your problem goes away.
I could see the issue was fixed with the codes of CVS head. Thank you for your information.

bug.short_desc: Add context-sensitive help for Sortkey and Filter Dialog

long_desc.thetext:
Follow the steps: 1.Select a Table or List; 2.In the property editor, you'll see Sorting page; 3.Click Add/Edit, it invokes a Mew/Edit Sortkey dialog; You can also find Filters Page in property editor.
Before, when user click "Add" button in Sorting page, a sortkey is added directly, but now I add a edit dialog to guide user to add/new a sortkey. It's the same to Filter page.
So we need to add context-sensitive for this two dialogs. Their Ids are "AddEditSortkey_ID" and "AddEditFilterCondition_ID".
BTW: The two dialogs are added when fixing bug 150579. Thank you.

bug.short_desc: Make ConfigurableContentOutlinePage$SelectionProvider public

long_desc.thetext: In order to talk to ConfigurableContentOutlinePage, some SelectionProvider class is needed. ConfigurableContentOutlinePage has SelectionProvider which is a inner class so we can not use it. For not only our editor but other editor/view provided by SSE, it is nice to make the SelectionProvider class public.

Nitin, please advise. Is the selection of the outline view "special" someway? Or, is there a better approach using generic platform selection services?
Miua-san, are you wanting to provide the behavior or implementation of this class? Such as for some other outline view? Or, are you just trying to "get" the selection from the outline view.
Its typically very helpful to state what you are trying to accomplish when requesting APIs. Especially as the implementation of the some particular seleciton provider is not a good candidate to be API. But ... not sure what you are trying to do, so some clarification would help.

When OutlinePage received the SelectionChanged event from our editor, ConfigurableContentOutlinePage$SelectionProvider sends the event as it is to the listeners of OutlinePage. Some view may not be able to treat the event from OutlinePage because selection type is not the expected one. (Ex. Editor sends the "Multi-Selection" event to the OutlineView, but the view which received the event from OutlineView can treat only "Single-Selection".)
In such a case, we want to modify the event to the proper one before SelectionProvider send it to the listeners of OutlineView.

Our Outline page's selection provider implements IPostSelectionProvider and helps prevent selection notification from bouncing back and forth between the outline and other parts. Otherwise, there's nothing special about its selection handling compared to the superclass'. The widget's TreeSelection is sent out without any modifications. Like the Properties view, another view receiving the selection event will have to deal with the multiple selection however it can.
Resolving as WONTFIX unless something further is needed.

bug.short_desc: Classcast Exception when using Hibernate

long_desc.thetext:
I mailed the following to John Arthorne regarding a strange issue when using objects in an Rich Client Application in combination with hibernate (3.2.0). He suggested to post this suggestion here.
Hi John,
I read your article on Drag & Drop. It is the only and best article to get drag and drop started for me while working on an RCP application.
However I ran into a very strange issue during the implementation of the XXXTransfer object (extends ByteArrayTransfer). I have a suggestion that this issue might be mentioned in the article to prevent other users from searching for a solution.
I got a ClassCastException in the first line of this method:
protected void javaToNative(Object object, TransferData transferData) { byte[] bytes = toByteArray((Gadget[])object); if (bytes != null) super.javaToNative(bytes, transferData); }
This was very strange because my 'Gadget' object was indeed an Array of 'Gadget' objects. My gadget objects were managed by hibernate. I do not know for sure but this article discusses a similar ClassCastException:
http://publib.boulder.ibm.com/infocenter/wasinfo/v4r0/index.jsp?topic=/com.ibm.support.was40.doc/html/Java_SDK/swg21188873.html
I am pretty sure, the same happened to me (because RCP applications have differing classloaders as well).
What about adding this note to the article?
(Or am I completely mistaken?).
For me the solution was to change the parameters of the toByteArray as wel as the writeGadget method from Gadget to Object.
Regards, Daniel

John, do you want to address this in your article? I assume that he's referring to:
http://www.eclipse.org/articles/Article-Workbench-DND/drag_drop.html

This sounds like some bizarre classloading issue that is probably unrelated to the focus of this article. While I agree that it does indeed sound like a pretty annoying problem, I'm not convinced that this article is the right place to address it. Feel free to argue with me. I'd like to close this bug as WONTFIX. Anybody disagree?
Since there's been no disagreement...

bug.short_desc: Difference in behavior is seen while exporting the "org.eclipse.cdt.make.core" as Deployable plugin by giving destination as 1. Archive file 2. Directory

long_desc.thetext:
Eclipse Version Used : 3.2 cdt version Used : 3.1 Operating System : Windows XP
Steps to reproduce the bug:
Scenario 1: 1. Checkout org.eclipse.cdt.make.core (of branch 3.1) plugin from cvs in workspace. 2. Select the plugin -> right click-> Export -> Plugin-Development-> Deployable plugins and fragments. 3. Select the destination as Archive file 4. Click on Finish.A zip file will be created. 5. Unzip the zip file. 6. Open the jar file with WinZip 7. One inner class "ProviderOptions.class" which should be present in ProfileOptions.class (exact path is ScannerConfigInfoFactory2$Store$ProfileOptions) does not come in jar file.
Scenario 2: 1. Checkout org.eclipse.cdt.make.core(of branch 3.2) pluging from cvs in workspace. 2. Select the plugin -> right click-> Export -> Plugin-Development-> Deployable Plugins and fragments. 3. Select the destination as Directory 4. Click on Finish. 5. Open the jar file with winzip 7. The inner class "ProviderOptions.class" comes in plugin. It's present in: ScannerConfigInfoFactory2$Store$ProfileOptions$ProviderOptions
Why the behavior is different in both scenarios?
Great question, forwarding to PDE who do the build. This may be a JDT compiler bug in the end, not sure...

Problem is a path length issue on windows where ant drops the nested class when creating a zip. Exporting to a folder is one workaround for the problem.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 69620 ***

bug.short_desc: Allow .execution file to be transformed into HTML report

long_desc.thetext:
Hi,
I am using TPTP for Automating Sonic features which are installed using Eclipse workbench. I am using Automated GUI Recorder. It is really very much helpful to automate Smoke scenarios and running them in standard mode.
But I am not able to send proper Execution Results. As TPTP generated a .execution file which is not an XML file. It would be better if the results are in XML form sothat I can make a HTML view for all the scripts using these XML.
Thank you, Rahul

Reassigning to the component that handles the .execution format.
Rahul, FYI, the .execution file is a zip file that contains a file named "ResourceContents". This "ResourceContents" file is an XML file.

(In reply to comment #1) > Reassigning to the component that handles the .execution format. > Rahul, FYI, the .execution file is a zip file that contains a file named > "ResourceContents". This "ResourceContents" file is an XML file.
Thank you for the prompt Ruth!
I just started working on my Result generation in HTML using the "ResourceContents" file. But I found a suggestion/enhancement. In the .execution file, we have link to the test case which is shown as "href="test-resources/XSDAutomation.testsuite#E86091D300E303FB8B72E450276E11DB" in the "ResourceContents" file. But it would be helpful if the "ResourceContents" file also contains the TestCase name.
Can anyone help me in this.
Thanks a lot in Advance.
Thanks, Rahul

Changed component.
Joe, could you see if there is any advice to give to Rahul in the current release related to his request, and if not, adjust the summary for an appropriate title for the future RFE.

Hi Rahul,
In addition to what Ruth has mentioned, I'd like to explain a bit more about the TPTP models. TPTP uses EMF models for storing our data, so there is a rich, generated Java API for accessing the data models. If you read the .execution file using the TPTP Java APIs, the reference you mention in your comment (which uses GUID to map to the invoked test case) is automatically navigated to the associated TestCase (from which you can simply call getName().)
Beyond that, TPTP has a reporting framework that uses the BIRT project to do generate rich HTML reports from TPTP test logs. There is also an Automatable Services Framework in TPTP which allows you to generate these reports from many different places, including from Java or from ANT scripts.
I'll be teaching a tutorial on ASF at EclipseWorld in Boston on Wednesday, September 6th. This is a great way to learn about ASF, but if you are unable to attend, the materials from the tutorial will be posted on the TPTP website (and you can also find the materials from the tutorial we presented at EclipseCon earlier this year on the same topic.)
Having said all that, I am closing this enhancement as "WORKSFORME". The reference you mention in your note ("href="test-resources/XSDAutomation.testsuite#E86091D300E303FB8B72E450276E11DB") is generated by EMF. Aside from the difficulty of adding the test case name to the persisted model, this would also result in data duplication (since the name of the test case is already stored in the referenced .testsuite file.) It would be bad for us to copy the name of the test case into the .execution file, because if we subsequently renamed the test case, all of the .execution copies of the test case name would be incorrect. Hopefully the detail I provided above will help you choose among the many ways to transform .execution files into html reports. I will attach an example html report for you to see.
Thanks.
Created an attachment (id=49297) Sample TPTP Test Pass Report

Thank you very much Joe,
I am sorry for the delayed response!!
I will try the steps you mentioned. I had a look at the report you attached and it is looking great!!
I assume this would be a great help for me.
I will get back to you again in case of any other issues. As of now I am closing this bug.
Thanks, Rahul

bug.short_desc: [data models] IDataModelProvider._provider_class

long_desc.thetext: There is a hole in the IDataModel API which often forces clients to reference the implementing IDataModelProvider classes in order to create new IDataModels. Idealy clients should only need to concern themselves with the IDataModelProperties interface for the IDataModel they are using. This hole is largely because the current implementation forces the use of extension points to create the necessary linkage between the IDataModelProperties interface and the backing IDataModelProvide class and extension points are notoriously difficult to keep up to date. The proposed fix is to create the linkage for the 99% case using a simple field to define the provider class. This will make it simple for IDataModel developers to create and maintain the linkage. This will not break the existing extension support for creating the linkage. Also, this is not a breaking API change because if an IDataModelProperties class fails to implement the _provider_class field the DataModelFactory code will fail loading the field gracefully and revert to loading the extension points.
Created an attachment (id=48171) patch

Approve with one minor change.
Remove the _provider_class field from the IDataModelProperties interface since it cannot be used in its current form. Add to the comment that this field should be implemented by interfaces that extend it. This is the basic pattern that they should follow. Customer's will need to read the interface comment to understand what to do in the first place (even if the field is there).

Created an attachment (id=48272) Updated patch
_provider_class field removed from IDataModelProperties and documentation moved up to the interface level.
Updated patch approved.
code dropped.

bug.short_desc: [Wizards] Wizard Dialog Pages Cut Off in High Contrast Mode

long_desc.thetext: In high contrast mode on Windows, if a wizard page has a lot of controls it's possible the dialog will be cut off making some of the controls inaccessible. I've seen a number of defects open about specific preference pages or dialogs. In my opinion, this sounds like something that could be fixed generically instead of making the same fix in multiple wizards. For example, the wizard dialog should be able to detect when everything cannot be displayed and add horizontal or vertical scroll bars.
Karice, can this accessibility issue be looked at for 3.2.1?

When I do a search in the Eclipse product for "high contrast wizard" I get 16 bugs, 8 of which are valid non-duplicate bugs (not counting this one), of which only 3 are not resolved.
The UI already does as much as it can to fix these bugs by sizing the dialog according to the computed size of the pages: https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=75631#c4
Scrolled composites present a whole other challenge that is not feasible to fix: https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=97590#c13
Also, it is not correct (or reasonable) behavior for the UI to change a page's layout as it could mess up the layout of the page. The bottom line is, the page author needs to ensure that there isn't too much content for the screen, and that the layout is sized large enough for the content.

bug.short_desc: MSIE mangles pages with homeitem below homeitem3col

long_desc.thetext:
Moving from layout.css 1.84 to 1.85 made IE start barfing (more specifically, it pushes the midcolumn entirely below the leftnav, and the homeitems to the right of the last homeitem3col) on any page with a homeitem below a homeitem3col, the content of which appears to not matter. Removing the #rightcolumn, .homeitem { clear: right } at the end of layout.css appears to revert the behaviour to the only slightly broken (see below) behaviour of before.
The example page also shows off another IE bug, where it won't float the homeitems left, and instead just displays them one on top of the other. The workaround is to have a list anywhere in any of the homeitem3cols (even an empty, display: none; one is sufficient).
I will attach the example page in a moment...
Created an attachment (id=48176) Example page

I see what you mean.
Removing #rightcolumn, .homeitem { clear: right } might fix your page. but it causes much larger problems for the rest of the site. Ex. the main homepage doesnt display correctly.
If you do find a solution attach a patch and we can test it. I will try a few things on my end to see if this can be fixed.

Actually it looks like just removing the clear: right; from .homeitem works. Thus,
#rightcolumn, .homeitem { clear: right }
becomes
#rightcolumn { clear: right }
does this still cause problems for you? This still leaves a small horizontal scrollbar in IE, but all page content is actually visible, so I'm not too worried about the scrollbar.
(Consequently, it turns out that removing both as I first suggested messes up the right sidebar, if present. I didn't notice because there wasn't one on the test page.)
I'd attach a patch, but the newlines in that file appear to be Mac OS <=9 (\r) format, and cvs/patch doesn't like those very much.

If we just remove the .homeitem, some of the problems are fixed while others are not. When resizing the browser on the main page we get one of the newsboxes clearing underneath the first one.
I think we need to take an indepth look at the way the details of the class homeitem and maybe re-examine whats really going on here.

The homepage has since been redesigned, and no longer combines both homeitem types on the same page. I'm not aware of any other page on our site that does this, but I'm wondering if it's worth investing the time to fix this -- having 3-col and 4-col content on the same page is just plain ugly anyway.
Thoughts?
My vote is to close as wontfix unless there's an easy way to fix this.
Closing as wontfix as per comment 5
Moving to Community/Website

bug.short_desc: Tomcat 4.1.x start timeout problem

long_desc.thetext:
Hi all,
I'm running a web application on tomcat 4.1 (the version is unfortunately not to be updated soon...) and created a project from it's source under eclipse 3.2 + WTP 1.5. I succesfully installed the tomcat 4.1 runtime under Preferences/Server, and created the server accordingly, then configured it properly. But when I start the server from the "Servers" pane, in normal or debug mode, I always get a timeout error after 45 seconds, resulting in a popup warning.
Extract from the eclipse log : !ENTRY org.eclipse.wst.server.core 4 0 2006-08-11 13:31:22.290 !MESSAGE Timeout waiting for Tomcat v4.1 Server @ localhost to start. Server did not start after 45s.
The strange thing is, the server IS actually running ! I can browse my application, and debugging also works perfectly. The annoying thing is that all restart options are greyed out, because the feature somehow thinks the server is not really started ... Besides, the "status" of the server stays stuck on "starting" with the animated green triangle. Is there a configuration tweek or something, that could help me get rid of this timeout ?
Thanks for your help. William
If you open the editor, under the Port section are port numbers correct? It pings the server to confirm whether it is started.

Hi Tim
thanks a lot for your reply. The port numbers were right in the "Ports" section. So I decided to start all over from scratch: installed a fresh tomcat 4.1, created a new runtime environment based on it along with a new server, which I started. And it works nice ... No more timeout problem... So I guess the issue might have come from an oddness in a my previous configuration file, probably in server.xml ? Considering the port numbers, I just noticed 2 "port name" differences between the failing configuration and the working one. In the former, they're called "org.apache.catalina.connector.http.HttpConnector" and "org.apache.ajp.tomcat4.Ajp13Connector" whereas in the latter, just : "HTTP Connector" and "AJP/1.3 Connector". Not sure this difference is supposed to mean anything :) Anyway, I'm fully satisfied with the new running server, hopefully definitively, so I guess this topic doesn't need further investigation. Thanks again for your concern.
William

I don't suppose any of the ports on the original server were labelled "Tomcat admin port"? It sounds like it was unable to recognize the ports that were in that previous server.xml. As a result, it could not connect to the server to confirm that it was started. I've checked on those port classes and they do not match the standard Tomcat v4.1 (or any other version I could find) port types. Since you've got it working now I'll close this bug. If you happen to run into it again please attach a copy of the Tomcat server.xml and a description of how you got or editted it. Thanks.
Closing old bugs.

bug.short_desc: NPE when bean on freeform is a string.

long_desc.thetext:
The StringLabelProvider doesn't expect "null" for the value of a string. Null is valid. It throws an NPE and stops processing the file.
It is a trivial fix. Just check for null.
Released into VE 1.2.1 M20060818 build.
1.2.1 is released.

bug.short_desc: API change request to ModuleFactory and ModuleFactoryDelegate

long_desc.thetext: Agreed. We used to have a getModule(String id) method and it was removed due to other problems. We should bring it back and will also need to investigate if there are other ways to lazily load modules. Currently, there are too many places that ask for the full list of modules, ruining any chances of improving the overall situation.

I'm going to use this bug to add new API to query modules by IProject and moduleId and push this through the server tools API and as much of the UI and tools as possible. This should allow lazy initialization in as many cases as possible, but there are still a couple cases (e.g. Add/Remove modules dialog) which currently need to load all modules of a particular type(s). (any ideas to improve that situation are welcome :) )
I'm not sure I want to comment on the modifications to Server since that seems to get further away from the current API and I don't have a clear vision of how it would be implemented. Unless you have strong objections I think the API changes listed above are natural extensions to the current API that we should implement now, and any other changes should be pushed back and handled via another bug if they are still required after validating these changes.

That sounds great. I have module factories which need to be able to load a module of a certain ID, but also don't want to be shown in the add-remove projects dialog or return a "complete" list of modules.
If the API you suggest is good enough (and forced through / used as much as possible) I can choose to ignore requests to get a full module list, while still responding to specific requests.
That's my use-case at least.

Changes complete. Did several reference searches and there are now only two exposed paths that will end up calling the full getModules():
ServerUtil.getModules(IModuleType[] moduleTypes) // returns all modules of an array of types - Only used by Add/Remove modules action
ServerUtil.getModules(String moduleType) // returns all modules of a given type - Only used by jst.j2ee utility to return parent modules (e.g. return all web modules that contain a given utility jar)
The first one is fairly contained and unavoidable, but the second may be used more often. For instance, Tomcat uses the utility in getRootModules() when checking if a utility modules is contained within a web module.
Note that I have no control over who calls this API from other components (e.g. Web Services) or in adopter products, nor any good way to find these references. I've added javadoc to these methods that's clear about the performance impact.
I plan to release this fix next week since we're currently in I-build shutdown.
Changes released to 2.0 M5 builds.
Old bug, closing.

bug.short_desc: duplicate schema element when generating WSDL

long_desc.thetext:
Hi,
I was trying to publish a Java interface as a WS and this error happens when clicking next in the WS wizard.
The interface has several overloaded methods, but I am just selecting one of them.

(In reply to comment #0) > Hi, > > I was trying to publish a Java interface as a WS and this error happens when > clicking next in the WS wizard. > > The interface has several overloaded methods, but I am just selecting one of > them. >
Sorry, I meant Java class, not interface.

Mariano, if possible, would you please attach the Java class or some equivalent, suitable example, and the resulting WSDL/Schema? Also, have you tried running your Java thru Axis' native Java2WSDL tool [1]? Chances are this an issue with the Axis emitters, in which case I would recommend filing a bug against Apache [2].
[1] http://ws.apache.org/axis/java/user-guide.html#Java2WSDLBuildingWSDLFromJava [2] http://issues.apache.org/jira/

Hello,
You were right. Running java2wsdl tool threw same exception. It works if wsdl style is not wrapped.
Thanks Mariano. I'm resolving this bug for closure since the problem is in the Apache Axis emitters.
Closed.

The webserver is not using https.
My jdk is: java version "1.5.0_07" Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.5.0_07-b03) Java HotSpot(TM) Server VM (build 1.5.0_07-b03, mixed mode)

I am using eclipse 3.2.
Okay thanks and I assume you're using Mylar release 0.6.1? Bumping up to P1.

From the rdf config you posted it appears as though your urlbase isn't set. I found a bug in our parser that was corrupting the config when the urlbase (rdf:about) value is empty. The work around is to set the urlbase in the bugzilla server parameters to something. Can you confirm that your urlbase was/is in fact empty in the bugzilla parameters?
That was my problem. Sorry about that; I was checking the wrong server when I verified that parameter.
No worries, thanks for confirming. The fix for handling an empty urlbase will be in the next release (this evening or Monday I believe).

bug.short_desc: [releng] releng.wtpbuilder: "*-tests" targets in wtp.tests/test.xml does not depend on "init"

long_desc.thetext:
I run wtp automatic tests with command like this (note the "-DtestTarget=jst-j2ee-tests" argument):
ant -Dbuild.home=D:/releng -DbuildType=M -DbuildId=1.5.1 -Dtimestamp=200608110237 -Dbaseos=win32 -Dbasews=win32 -Dbasearch=x86 -Dbuild.stream=R1.5 -DbuildBranch=R1.5 -Djava15-home="c:/Program Files/Java/jdk1.5.0_06" -DcvsServer=sofs00001453a -DtestTarget=jst-j2ee-tests -f D:/releng/releng.wtpbuilder/distribution/wtp.tests/standaloneTest.xml
Unfortunately, no test actually is executed and no xml and html report is generated. However, if I remove the "-DtestTarget" argument, then, as expected, all tests are executed and reports are generated properly.
My investigations shows that the reason for the script not working with the "-DtestTarget" argument is because "*-tests" target does not depend on the "init" target where important initializations are done. The "all" target depends on "init". In addition the following tag has to be moved from the "all" target to "init" target:
<property file="test2.properties"/>
Patch that solve the issue is attached.
Created an attachment (id=48184) patch

The patch would no longer apply, appologies for the delay,
but the concepts were sound and easy to add "by hand".
I did add a conditional on the compute task, so it wouldn't rerun for every test suite, if "test2.properties" had already been computed.
I've released to the 3.0 builds, and if normal tests work ok, I'll apply to 2.0.1 as well.
And, then let you verify original problem is fixed :)

The fix in 3.0 seemed fine, so I put in 2.0.1 as well.
Thanks for the suggestion.
And ... you know what would be nice ... if you documented how-to-do a standalone test and added this info. (if it's not already there).

bug.short_desc: Add "task number" variable to Automatic Commit Messages template

long_desc.thetext: Trac needs a # (hash sign) prefix to understand a number as a ticket number, so I'd like to define my "Completed task prefix" as ``Completed ticket #${task_number}: and have Mylar replace "${task_number}" with the task number, instead of simply appending the number to the end of the "Completed task prefix".
Steffen: when investigating improving the commit message support for Trac refer to the commit template discussion on bug 117517.
The commit comment template can now be customized in the preferences. It now contains a hash sign followed by the ticket id by default.

bug.short_desc: Misleading error marker in source margin

long_desc.thetext:
Steps to reproduce
1. Create the XML Examples 2. Launch either the wsdl or xsd editors 3. Look at the right margin of the source view. There is an error: "Content is not allowed in the prolog"
If you validate the files, they are ok.
Keith, is this something new to WTP 1.5.1? Can you narrow down when this problem crept in?
This was not in last week's declared integration driver.
Keith, does this error occur with any specific file in the example or all of them?

All wsdl and xsd files in the examples.
Also, create a new WSDL file with content and you'll see it.
However, if you create a new XSD, you do not see the error.
This problem was caused by a performance fix put in for bug 136935. Jeff is going to revert the fix today so this bug should be resolved in this week's I-build.
This problem has been fixed in 1.5.1 builds from 20060824 and later.
Verified in wtp-sdk-M-1.5.1-200608241726.zip
Closing bug

bug.short_desc: Display Downloadable Server Adapters in Main List

long_desc.thetext: The current server tools UI provides a link to downloadable server adapters. Instead of a link, the downloadable server adapters should be included in the main list with a different icon to indicate that they need to be downloaded. This makes it clearer to the user what servers are available and reduces the complexity of the UI.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 120699 ***
I am closing this since it is a dup of bug 120699

bug.short_desc: OCL defined operations and properties presist across Environments

long_desc.thetext:
Additional operations and properties defined using OCL are stroed in an adapter on the owner EClassifier. This allows subsequent OCL expressions to make use of them. These additional operation and properties are also present if the OCL expression is evaluated using different Environments.
Should these additional operations and properties only be accessible if used within the same Environment used when they were defined?

The J2SE 5.0 (bug 156361) and UML Metamodel support (bug 163808) enhancements are changing the way that additional operations and properties are managed; they will be scoped to the environment, not global.

The new org.eclipse.ocl.OCL API retains separate definitions of additional attributes and operations, effectively creating isolated OCL environments. These additional features are no longer attached to the model elements.

bug.short_desc: some operations fail if repository is accessed anonymously

long_desc.thetext:
If repositories are accessed anonymously which is permitted for most Trac repositories these methods will display an error message and not execute the appropriate operation:
* AbstractRepositoryConnector.attachContext() * TaskUiUtil.refreshAndOpenTaskListElement()
There should either be some kind of method to validate a repository in a connector dependent way (i.e. AbstractRepositoryConnector.isValid(TaskRepository)) or an exception should be thrown when the operation is actually executed.

I think that we should continue encapsulating operations via the handler classes that we've started adding. So I assume the first problem can be addressed by the suggestion on bug 151900?
Why/how does TaskUiUtil.refreshAndOpenTaskListElement() fail? That method should be robust to any legal state that a repository can be in. Could you mock up a simple failing test?

I think capability checks and TaskRepository validation are two separate things that need to be handled separately. The capability checks should be done as early as possible and disable/hide actions for repositories that do not support them.
The repository validation take place when an action is run and a meaningful message should be displayed when it fails. In case of the context attach/retrieve actions I would do the validation prior to displaying the wizard.
I have a (large) patch that adds canUpload()/canDownload() methods to IAttachmentHandler and a validate() method to AbstractRepositoryConnector. I'll try to split the patch up so it can be reviewed more easily.
Created an attachment (id=48239) Connector specific repository validation
Created an attachment (id=48240) mylar/context/zip
Patch applied.
Resolved.
